title: PSA- focusing on what your allies did wrong is pointless.
body:
This applies out of game. If your malphite did a bad engage that made you guys lose, what could you do to stop it?
If the ADC got caught out? 
If the top "fed"?

there isn't anything you can do to help them stop being bad or making mistakes, so there is no use worrying about it. In ranked you should focus on what you can improve on, focusing on what someone else can improve on is a waste of time. (unless you are directly teaching them)

replies.body:
Yes, you can. You can politely explain to them why it was a poor decision and what they could have done instead.

Some small percent (the mature adults) will listen and improve, instead of crying and screaming.

If they cry and scream, you block them and let them feed, and get on with the game. Nothing can help arrogant babies.
Exactly. My friend is going through the classic bronze phase of "if only bot didn't feed so hard". Most, if not all have gone through it. I'm made this post for those who haven't realized this yet.
ppl are just getting mad and pointing out bad mistakes..its a normal habit

I really hate when people ask "Why?"
It's one of those things that tilts me so hard.
What do they expect me to say?
I thought I could get the kill.
I mean I have told a Blitzcrank after game that repeating pulling the Amumu in the middle of our team was not very helpful. You can always hope they'll learn for their next game.
That's more of the teaching side. good on you (as long as you didn't phrase it in a rude way)
PSA telling us pointless things is right though?

I apologize but i don't seem to understand. 
Are you saying that telling people not to be toxic is pointless...?

of course not

if i tell my teammate that they suck it will magically destroy the enemy nexus, right?

Yeah. OFC. Don't forget to call the AFK a retard, it will win you games
